newsitem.title: DUBAI: Gulf border rows render alliance ineffective - paper.
newsitem.headline: Gulf border rows render alliance ineffective - paper.

text.p: Continued border disputes among Gulf Arab states jeopardise the effectiveness of a six-nation Gulf alliance, a United Arab Emirates (UAE) newspaper said on Monday in a rare criticism of the regional group.

"These disputes have become like time bombs that could explode as a result of surprise actions by one party, misunderstanding on the part of another or due to foreign abuse," al-Khaleej Arabic daily said in a front-page editorial.
"It is regrettable that no measures have been adopted to put a border dispute mechanism in place, or a binding charter drawing the lines that no party can override in any border row."

It said a territorial row between Qatar and Bahrain could have adverse implications on the effectiveness of the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC), which also groups Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, the UAE and Oman.

Bahrain has threatened to boycott the GCC summit in Doha in December over the row. Several other border rows, including some that sparked clashes, between other members of the 15-year alliance are being settled in bilateral negotiations.
